content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 150.6 - Performance/longevity payments

State Regulations
(a) An
employee who completes 10 and/or 15 years of continuous service in a
supervisory position in the security occupational series is eligible to be
considered for a performance/longevity payment equal to the amount shown in the
salary schedule applicable to employees in the Security Supervisors Negotiating

Unit for the salary grade to which the employee's position is allocated. In
order for an employee to be eligible for a performance/longevity payment, the
rating immediately prior to his/her completion of 10 and/or 15 years of
continuous service in a supervisory position in the security supervisors
occupational series must be outstanding, excellent, good, or needs
improvement. (b) Performance/longevity payments shall be added to and considered part of base
pay for all purposes except for determining an employee's change in salary upon
movement to a different salary grade and his/her potential for movement to the
job rate. After such determination, the performance/longevity payment shall be
restored. (c) Performance/longevity
payments shall be payable effective on the first payroll period closest to the
completion of 10 and/or 15 years of continuous service in a supervisory
position in the security occupational series. (d) In no case may an employee's salary
exceed the performance/longevity maximum of the salary grade by virtue of a
performance/longevity payment. However, that portion of the
performance/longevity payment which would bring the employee's salary up to the
performance/longevity maximum shall be paid as a performance/longevity
payment. Notes
